isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING - Headlight System With International Turn Signal Switch, With USA DRL, Air Brakes, and International Engine

svcproc.title: Headlight System With International Turn Signal Switch, With USA DRL, Air Brakes, and International Engine

table.title: Headlight System With International Turn Signal Switch, With USA DRL, Air Brakes, and International Engine

entry.para: Remove fuse F26 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F26, and at circuit 14F measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14F, then repair.
Remove fuse F24 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F24, and at circuit 14E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14E, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (35) and at circuit 50A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50A, then repair.
At conn. (35) and circuit 50B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50 or 50B, then repair.
Test headlight sw. (35) by moving switch to park light on position and measuring resistance from terminal 4 to 5.
Test headlight sw. (35) by moving switch to the headlight on position and measuring resistance from terminals 1 to 2 and 5 to 6.
Remove lift-to-dim relay from relay socket (274) and reconnect conn. (35). With headlight switch in headlight on, measure voltage at (274) from circuit 51C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51C, then repair.
At the lift-to-dim relay socket (274), with headlight switch in park light on, measure voltage at (274) from circuit 51C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51C, then repair.
At conn. (274) with headlight sw. in park light on, measure voltage from circuit 51C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51C, then repair.
At conn. (274) with headlight switch in headlight on, measure voltage from circuit 51C to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51C, then repair.
Disconnect dimmer switch conn. (458) and measure resistance from circuit 51-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51-G or 11-G, then repair.
At conn. (458) and pigtail to sw., measure resistance from term. B to C with switch in dim position.
At conn. (458) and pigtail to sw., measure resistance from term. B to A while holding sw. handle forward in flash-to-pass position.
Reconnect conn. (458) and move to dim position. With headlight sw. in park light on position, at (274) measure voltage from cir. 51C to 51D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, then repair.
Keep in dim position and move headlight sw. to headlight on position, at (274) measure voltage from circuit 51C to 51D.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51D, then repair.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (274) by measuring resistance from term. 30 to 87A.
Bench test lift-to-dim relay (274) by applying +12V to term. 85 and gnd. to term. 86. Then measure resistance from term. 30 to 87.
Move headlight sw. to off and re-install lift-to-dim relay. Do low beam headlights function properly?
W/Dual Drive Cab. Remove dimmer sw. 1 relay from relay socket (274A). With headlight sw. in headlight on, measure voltage at (274A) from circuit 51AB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51AB, then repair.
W/Dual Drive Cab. At the dimmer sw. 1 relay socket (274A), with headlight sw. in park light on, measure voltage at (274A) from circuit 51AB to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51AB, then repair.
W/Dual Drive Cab. At dimmer switch 1 relay socket (274A) with headlight switch in park light on, measure voltage from circuit 51AB and 51DA to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51DA, then repair.
W/Dual Drive Cab. At the closed second dimmer switch (421) with headlight switch in park light on, measure voltage from circuit 51DA to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 51DA and 51-GAA, then repair.
W/Dual Drive Cab. Re-install dimmer sw. 1 relay. Remove dimmer sw. 2 relay from relay socket (274B) with headlight sw. in park light on, measure voltage from circuit 51B and 51N to gnd.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 51B, 51N, 51D and 51AA, then repair.
W/Dual Drive Cab. At the dimmer sw. 2 relay socket (274B) with headlight sw. in park light on, move to dim position, measure voltage from circuit 51B and 51N to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 51B, 51N, 51D and 51AA, then repair.
Move headlight switch to off and re-install dimmer switch 2 relay. Do low beam headlights function properly?
Disconnect conn. (2), move headlight sw. to headlight position, and measure voltage to gnd. at cir. 53 on the cab side of the connector.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53 or 53A, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (413) and reconnect conn. (2). With headlight switch still on and the dimmer switch set to dim, at (413) measure voltage from circuit 53 [going to (2)] to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53 from (2), then repair.
Disconnect conn. (502) and (504) and reconnect (413). At (502) with switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 53B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53 or 53B, then repair.
At (504) measure voltage from circuit 53A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53 or 53A, then repair.
At conn. (502) with headlight switch in headlight position and dimmer switch set to dim, measure voltage from circuit 53B to 11-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GJ, 11-GB or 11-GC, then repair.
At conn. (504) with headlight switch still on and dimmer switch set to dim, measure voltage from circuit 53A to 11-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11-GE, then repair.
Do high beam headlights function properly?
Disconnect conn. (2), move dimmer switch to high beam position, and with headlight switch still on, measure voltage from (2), cir. 52 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52 or 52C, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (413) and reconnect conn. (2). With switches still set, measure voltage at (413) circuit 52 [going to (2)] to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52, then repair.
With switches still set and conn. (502) disconnected reconnect conn. (413) and at (502) and circuit 52C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52 or 52C, then repair.
With headlight switch in headlight position and dimmer switch in high beam position, at (504) measure voltage from circuit 52B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52B, then repair.
Does the flash-to-pass feature function properly?
Remove flash-to-pass relay (273) and measure voltage from circuit 50D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50D, then repair.
At relay socket (273), measure voltage from circuit 50C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50C, then repair.
At relay socket (273), measure voltage from circuit 50C to 51E while an assistant holds the turn signal lever forward.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 51E, then repair.
Bench test flash-to- pass relay (273) by measuring resistance from term. 30 to 87A.
Bench test flash-to- pass relay (273) by applying +12V to terminal 85 and ground to 86, and measuring resistance from term. 30 to 87.
Re-install flash-to-pass relay (273) and reconnect (502) and (504). With headlight switch still on, hold turn signal lever forward. Do bright lights illuminate?
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52E, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (178) and with headlight switch in headlight position and dimmer switch in dim position, at (178) circuit 66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66C, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam position and at conn. (178) circuit 66E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66E, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (165) and reconnect (178). with switches still set, at (165) measure voltage from circuit 66E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66E, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to dim position and at conn. (165) circuit 66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66C, then repair.
At conn. (165) and circuit 66-GA, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-GA, then repair.
Move key switch to accessories position and at conn. (165) circuit 66, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66, then repair.
Remove fuse F31 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F31, and at circuit 14L, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14L, then repair.
At conn. (165) measure voltage from circuit 66A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66A, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (168) and at circuit 66-G measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-G, then repair.
With parking brake applied, measure resistance across park brake switch (168).
Replace defective DRL park brake switch.
Reconnect conn. (168) and disconnect conn. (28). With park brake applied, at conn. (165) and circuit 66J, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66J or 66K, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (91) and reconnect conn. (165). Move headlight switch to headlight position, and dimmer switch to dim position. At conn. (91) circuit 64A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 64A or replace DRL module if circuit checks good.
Reconnect connector (91). DRL circuits check good. If system fails to function properly, replace DRL module.
